message: Once in a while I run into Ruby centric podcasts like today I found http://thechangelog.com/ (There are others). Are there any podcast that are more Python centric?
I enjoyed listening to both "A little bit of Python" as well as "from Python import Podcast", but afaik it's been a while since the last episode
Great, I'll check em out. Thanks.
Python coverage on The Changelog should be picking up soon. I just have to set aside the time.
Last time we tried to record, there was some "issues" with "buttons" not being pressed "properly" (at all).  We are planning to record *at* pycon.

From python import podcast has had some scheduling issues.  We're working on getting back on track.  If you like us, heckle the convore group for motivation :P https://convore.com/from-python-import-podcast/
@benjaminws good to hear! Consider this message also a heckle to continue the good work :)
I'm lazy enough to ask--is there an automated way to get transcripts of podcasts?
@tiarno , I think the sound to text technique at the moment can't make very pleasant result yet.
@jessenoller: yeah, I'm responsible for all the python content.
@0chris A Little Bit of Python has been dormant as we have all been busy (people having babies, graduating, moving, etc.). Hopefully we can line something up at PyCon like we did last year.
As someone new to the Python community, have to say I'm missing the ability to subscribe to a regular, reliable podcast.
I have a recorded interview with Armin Rigo waiting for me to edit...
